    Confused By Plan Terms?

    What's a Zap?

    A Zap is a link between two services (a "trigger" and an "action"). Zaps run automatically in the background every few minutes to move and manage data on your behalf. Only live Zaps count against your limit — you can have as many paused and unfinished Zaps as you'd like. For example, one Zap might be "Send me an SMS every time I get a new email".

    What are Tasks?

    A Task is counted every time we move a piece of data or take some action on your behalf during a pay period or month. If you set up a filter, we don't count filtered items against your Task limit.

    What are Services?

    A Service is a web service or app, such as Facebook, Gmail, or SalesForce. Zapier integrates with over 193 services and counting and lets you move data between them.

    What are Premium services?

    Some services on Zapier are marked as 'Premium'. To use these services in your zaps, you'll need to have a paid plan.

    Have Questions?

    Can I change my plan later on?

    Yes, you can upgrade or downgrade at any time. If you choose to upgrade you'll pay a pro-rated amount for the rest of the month. If you choose to downgrade you'll be credited on next month's bill.

    What if I decide to cancel?

    If you no longer wish to use Zapier, you can cancel at any time. You will receive a pro-rated credit with Zapier for the remainder of that month's billing cycle.

    Is phone support available?

    We offer phone support to our Business Plus plan members. You can schedule a phone call with us for personal-level support during regular business hours.

    Do I need to know how to code?

    No! Zapier makes it easy for you to move data between your web services without being a developer. We may need you to locate information for certain accounts (things like API keys), but we'll guide you through any additional steps required.

    I have more questions. Who do I ask?

    Check out our support page, or you can email us at contact@zapier.com.

    Need more? Send us a message and we can let you in on our enterprise plans.

    {{JST "pricing_about"}} ');window.JST["pricing_base"]=JST('
    ');window.JST["pricing_about"]=JST('

    Confused By Plan Terms?

    What's a Zap?

    A Zap is a link between two services (a "trigger" and an "action"). Zaps run automatically in the background every few minutes to move and manage data on your behalf. Only live Zaps count against your limit — you can have as many paused and unfinished Zaps as you'd like. For example, one Zap might be "Send me an SMS every time I get a new email".

    What are Tasks?

    A Task is counted every time we move a piece of data or take some action on your behalf during a pay period or month. If you set up a filter, we don't count filtered items against your Task limit.

    What are Services?

    A Service is a web service or app, such as Facebook, Gmail, or SalesForce. Zapier integrates with over 193 services and counting and lets you move data between them.

    What are Premium services?

    Some services on Zapier are marked as 'Premium'. To use these services in your zaps, you'll need to have a paid plan.

    Have Questions?

    Can I change my plan later on?

    Yes, you can upgrade or downgrade at any time. If you choose to upgrade you'll pay a pro-rated amount for the rest of the month. If you choose to downgrade you'll be credited on next month's bill.

    What if I decide to cancel?

    If you no longer wish to use Zapier, you can cancel at any time. You will receive a pro-rated credit with Zapier for the remainder of that month's billing cycle.

    Is phone support available?

    We offer phone support to our Business Plus plan members. You can schedule a phone call with us for personal-level support during regular business hours.

    Do I need to know how to code?

    No! Zapier makes it easy for you to move data between your web services without being a developer. We may need you to locate information for certain accounts (things like API keys), but we'll guide you through any additional steps required.

    I have more questions. Who do I ask?

    Check out our support page, or you can email us at contact@zapier.com.

    ');window.JST["pricing_about"]=JST('

    Confused By Plan Terms?

    What's a Zap?

    A Zap is a link between two services (a "trigger" and an "action"). Zaps run automatically in the background every few minutes to move and manage data on your behalf. Only live Zaps count against your limit — you can have as many paused and unfinished Zaps as you'd like. For example, one Zap might be "Send me an SMS every time I get a new email".

    What are Tasks?

    A Task is counted every time we move a piece of data or take some action on your behalf during a pay period or month. If you set up a filter, we don't count filtered items against your Task limit.

    What are Services?

    A Service is a web service or app, such as Facebook, Gmail, or SalesForce. Zapier integrates with over 193 services and counting and lets you move data between them.

    What are Premium services?

    Some services on Zapier are marked as 'Premium'. To use these services in your zaps, you'll need to have a paid plan.

    Have Questions?

    Can I change my plan later on?

    Yes, you can upgrade or downgrade at any time. If you choose to upgrade you'll pay a pro-rated amount for the rest of the month. If you choose to downgrade you'll be credited on next month's bill.

    What if I decide to cancel?

    If you no longer wish to use Zapier, you can cancel at any time. You will receive a pro-rated credit with Zapier for the remainder of that month's billing cycle.

    Is phone support available?

    We offer phone support to our Business Plus plan members. You can schedule a phone call with us for personal-level support during regular business hours.

    Do I need to know how to code?

    No! Zapier makes it easy for you to move data between your web services without being a developer. We may need you to locate information for certain accounts (things like API keys), but we'll guide you through any additional steps required.

    I have more questions. Who do I ask?

    Check out our support page, or you can email us at contact@zapier.com.
